metadata.dc:title: Clinical management of a mandibular second molar with root entomolaris
metadata.dc:creator: Jiménez Oritz, J. L
Del Río Cazares, T. M
metadata.dc:description: This case report describes endodontic therapy on amandibular second molar with three roots: one mesial and two distal; distobuccal and distolingual (radix entomolaris) and four root canals: two in mesial and other two in distal. The canals were shape with Protaper Universal rotary files and irrigated with 2.5% sodium hypochlorite, 17% EDTA and normal saline as the final irrigant. The canals were them obturated with single cone of Pro Taper Universal gutta-percha and Sealapex sealer. This case shows unusual anatomic configuration and points out the importance of the knowledge of internal root canal anatomy (AU)
metadata.dc:title: Manejo clínico de un Segundo molar mandibular con raíz entomolaris
